data.title: Chinese University of Hong Kong – Shenzhen (China)
data.text:
CUHK-Shenzhen provides a variety of programs across 5 schools and 15+ programmes (majors) that students can choose from. Students can take a variety of courses across all 5 schools: the School of Management and Economics (SME), the School of Science and Engineering (SSE), the School of Humanities and Social Sciences (HSS), the School of Life and Health Sciences (LHS), and the School of Data Science. Courses range from: Finance, Global Business Studies, Marketing and Communication, Economics, Statistics, Mathematics and Applied Mathematics, Computer Science and Engineering, Electronic Information Engineering, New Energy Science and Engineering, Bioinformatics, and Translation. In order to have an idea of what classes are available, you should visit the CUHK-Shenzhen OneDrive.

You will need to be sure that you are registered as a full time student according to CUHK – Shenzhen and Rutgers University. That means you will need to take approximately 12-15 credits while abroad. It is not possible to take classes as not-for-credit or pass/fail.

For information about Study Abroad credit transfer, registration, and transcripts please visit the Academics section of our website.

On-campus housing is not guaranteed at this time. Students will be responsible for securing their own off-campus housing. Some housing recommendations of communities nearby that students can consider reserving a spot for themself, include but are not limited to:

颐安都会中央 - City Center, Property Office contact number: 0086-0755-89233091

中海康城国际花园 - Olympic City, Property Office contact number: 0086-13631569637

睿智华庭 - The Noble Court, Property Office contact number: 0086-0755- 33299180

Most of the available options are 2 or 3 bedrooms rentals. Note, 1-bedroom apartment rentals are very limited.
